byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from Baltimore, and John Surico from New York.
byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Fragile peace holds in Baltimore as big crowd demonstrates ahead of curfew; Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake and police attempt to diminish hopes that residents will learn details soon about circumstances of Freddie Gray's death after being injured in police custody.
lead_paragraph: An edgy peace held as a crowd took to the streets Wednesday night, and the mayor and police sought to tamp down expectations that residents would learn details soon about how a young black man died.

headline.main: Baltimore Leaders Try to Curb Expectations Over a Pending Police Report
headline.print_headline: City Leaders Try to Curb Expectations Over a Pending Police Report

snippet: An edgy peace held as a crowd took to the streets Wednesday night, and the mayor and police sought to tamp down expectations that residents would learn details soon about how a young black man died.
